main_text:
Analytical Marxism is a predominantly Anglophone variety
of Marxism that emerged in the late 1970s, and whose leading
proponents are located in philosophy and social science departments in
US and European universities. It can be distinguished from certain
classical forms of Marxism by its openness to analytical methods, its
critical attitude to certain substantive Marxist claims, its
acknowledgement of its own normative commitments, and its assertion of
the need for socialist design.
